    • Method Detail

      • play

        public long play()
        Description copied from interface: Sound
        Plays the sound at full volume, center panning. If it is already playing, it will be played again concurrently.
        Specified by:
        play in interface Sound
        Returns:
        -1 on failure, otherwise the unique ID of the playing instance.

      • play

        public long play(float volume)
        Description copied from interface: Sound
        Plays the sound at the specified volume, center panning. If it is already playing, it will be played again concurrently.
        Specified by:
        play in interface Sound
        Parameters:
        volume - The volume to play at where 0.0 is silent and 1.0 is full volume
        Returns:
        -1 on failure, otherwise the unique ID of the playing instance.

      • play

        public long play(float volume,
                 float pitch,
                 float pan)
        Description copied from interface: Sound
        Plays the sound at the specified volume, pitch and panning. If it is already playing, it will be played again concurrently.
        Specified by:
        play in interface Sound
        Parameters:
        volume - The volume to play at where 0.0 is silent and 1.0 is full volume
        pitch - The pitch multiplier where 1.0 is default, >1 is faster and <1 is slower. The value range must be between 0.5 and 2.0
        pan - The panning where -1.0 is full left, 1.0 is full right and 0.0 is center.
        Returns:
        -1 on failure, otherwise the unique ID of the playing instance.

      • loop

        public long loop()
        Description copied from interface: Sound
        Loops the sound at full volume, center panning . If it is already playing, it will be played again concurrently.
        Specified by:
        loop in interface Sound
        Returns:
        -1 on failure, otherwise the unique ID of the playing instance.

        Specified by:
        loop in interface Sound
        Parameters:

      • loop

        public long loop(float volume,
                 float pitch,
                 float pan)
        Description copied from interface: Sound
        Loops the sound at the specified volume, pitch and panning. If it is already playing, it will be played again concurrently.
        Specified by:
        loop in interface Sound
        Parameters:
        volume - The volume to play at where 0.0 is silent and 1.0 is full volume
        pitch - The pitch multiplier where 1.0 is default, >1 is faster and <1 is slower. The value range must be between 0.5 and 2.0
        pan - The panning where -1.0 is full left, 1.0 is full right and 0.0 is center.
        Returns:
        -1 on failure, otherwise the unique ID of the playing instance.

      • stop

        public void stop(long soundId)
        Description copied from interface: Sound
        Stops the specific instance of this sound. If it is no longer playing this has no effect.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Sound
        Parameters:
        soundId - The sound ID that was returned when play/loop was called

      • setLooping

        public void setLooping(long soundId,
                       boolean looping)
        Description copied from interface: Sound
        Sets if the specific instance of this sound should loop. If it is no longer playing this has no effect.
        Specified by:
        setLooping in interface Sound
        Parameters:
        soundId - The sound ID that was returned when play/loop was called
        looping - True if the sound should loop

      • setPitch

        public void setPitch(long soundId,
                     float pitch)
        Description copied from interface: Sound
        Sets the pitch of the specific instance of this sound. If it is no longer playing this has no effect.
        Specified by:
        setPitch in interface Sound
        Parameters:
        soundId - The sound ID that was returned when play/loop was called
        pitch - The pitch multiplier where 1.0 is default, >1 is faster and <1 is slower. The value range must be between 0.5 and 2.0

        Parameters:

        volume - The volume to play at where 0.0 is silent and 1.0 is full volume

      • setPan

        public void setPan(long soundId,
                   float pan,
                   float volume)
        Description copied from interface: Sound
        Sets the pan and volume of the specific instance of this sound. If it is no longer playing this has no effect.
        Specified by:
        setPan in interface Sound
        Parameters:
        soundId - The sound ID that was returned when play/loop was called
        pan - The panning where -1.0 is full left, 1.0 is full right and 0.0 is center.
        volume - The volume to play at where 0.0 is silent and 1.0 is full volume
